comments:
Created an attachment (id=80919)
report design

Description:
Exception is thrown out when open the attached report and eclipse is freezed.

Build number:
2.2.1.v20071022-0630

Steps to reproduce:
1. Open the attached report from an old version, click "OK" for the Warning 
   dialogue to ask if convert it to a format supported by the current versoion.

Expected result:
No exception.

Actual result:
Exception is thrown out.

Error log:
java.lang.NumberFormatException: The input value can't be parsed.

Created an attachment (id=82412)
screen shot

The report file contains a grid without column at line 812:

---------------------------------------------------------------
  <grid>
      <property name="style">style2</property>
      <row>
        <cell>
           <image name="image9">
              <property name="height">2cm</property>
              <property name="width">7cm</property>
              <expression name="uri">"../pic/actuate.jpg"</expression>
              <text-property name="helpText">(31)../pic/actuate.jpg name=image9                     
                   height=2cm width=7cm</text-property>
           </image>
        </cell>
      </row>
  </grid>
----------------------------------------------------------------

This is a error grid, no way to layout. So an exception is thrown at 
   org.eclipse.birt.report.designer.util.FixTableLayoutCalculator:308.

If modify the line "throw new NumberFormatException..." to "return new int[0];", then the report will be shown in latest version BIRT. Please see the second attachment, a screen shot. I guess the error grid shoud be convert such as aother error item which is in the screen shot.
The 'FixTableLayoutCalculator.java' isn't modified in CVS, so that to find more error in future.

Created an attachment (id=82631)
revised design file

This file has been manually modified since UI would not create the grid without columns. And "grid4" has two rows, one row has 2 columns, the other row has 1 column. 

After filling columns in grids that contains "image8" or "image9", the report can be opened successfully.
